> > Hi everybody,
> > I've written a TestCase for one class.
> > Is there a way to test another class with this test?
> > The problem is: it is impossible to pass second one as parameter to "Test
> > suite()" method (as it is static and passing will give one result:
> > last class will be tested twice). Changing test is not really good
> > (as there will be some more classes that I would like to test with
> > TestCase).
>
> I assume you want to run many tests at one time. The normal way is to
> create a class that collects the TestCase  classes together:
[...]

No. There idea is:
public interface IF{
  public static Object calculate(String str,int i);
}

public class A implements IF{
  //implementation
}

public class B implements IF{
  //implementation
}
//Strategy pattern is used

I know that result will be the same running class A and B. I've made test for
class A, eg
TestA, now I want to test B with this test. The problem is: to pass class B to
that test and test A and B at one time.


Sincerely yours,
Vladimir Bilyov
